message:
Dears,
Anyone tried crossover.com ? Are they trustworthy ?
For anyone who doesn't know them they're having remote working opportunities
You get hired after successfully complete a series of tests and interviews
And then they outsource you to third party clients
They have their tracking software as well which take screenshots from your screen and take photos from your webcam as well while you're working
If you have an experience with them it would be great if you can share it with us.
Thanks.

data.message:
I think I've seen their job posts under several different names (like DevFactory) years ago.
From the answers in the below thread, you probably better not to apply for such hectic company.
https://www.quora.com/Is-Crossover-similar-to-a-freelancer-organization-or-a-service-provider

Yes I've seen this, but I also heard that they're for real
So I thought I might get personal opinions as well
But changing company name so many times doesn't seem right
I like always to find alternative on producthunt.com

Another review for the same company but under different name , DevFactory.
http://www.mouthshut.com/review/DevFactory-review-umlmpsmorr
I've worked with them for a while, they're real.
Thanks Diaa for your response.. Could you please tell us what was the cons you found ?

it pays well and it's relatively stable, they are having a lot of structure changes in the past  2 years or so, but if you're working well, even if the team you're in shuts down, they move you to another team.
In my opinion it's good, but not a long term position, however this depends on your ambitions and goals.
no they are not .. searc the net .. there are a couple of articles on them
Try to check its website reputation from google
